definition: public morals are degenerating with each passing day (idiom)
surname Shi
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Every generation is convinced there has been a deplorable breakdown of manners.
sentences.chinese: 每一代人都相信世风日下，令人叹息。

moral bankruptcy/moral degeneracy
the ways of the world/the morals of the time
vice/immorality/moral turpitude

public morals
(coll.) nowadays
to put money above everything else
to cause a lot of trouble/to inflict much suffering
to be lost/to be ruined/to perish/to wither away
offending public morals (idiom)
to be getting worse with each generation
